main event: An unidentified flying object was observed on radar and visually by military personnel in Spragueville, Maine on August 17, 1956.
interesting points: The object was tracked on radar for three minutes before disappearing at 4000 yards,The object was estimated to have been moving at over 500 knots,There were discrepancies between the radar operator's and pilot's scopes,Equipment malfunction was suggested due to the inability to visually identify the object at 4000 yards,The conclusions drawn about the object varied widely, ranging from balloon to unknown.
witness description: military personnel involved in radar tracking and visual observation
